reviews.review_msg: Apparently you can speak in every tutorial and lecture and still not get 15/15 for participation. I have no clue what John is thinking when he decided on how things are graded, but if the highest tutorial mark is 14.1/15 then I have no idea. Can't get above 90% cause that means you do work he can't do.

1990 called, they want their statistics and articles back because even they know a hell of a lot can change in the environment in 30 years. Most recent article was maybe 2010? Still over 10 years old so the course almost a complete waste of time. Run, run as fast as you can.

Save yourself and DO NOT TAKE A COURSE WITH HIM! Not everyone can teach nor should they! Spends more time with the park board than with his students and marking. Be prepared to feel confident about what you have handed in only to find out during the final exam that you have been doing poorly and it is now too late. HORRIBLE!!!!!!

Satisfactory prof, although you can tell he is very knowledgeable. Made with laugh a few times with the odd Dad joke, which is nice. You will do well on your papers if you agree with him. Don't buy the textbook, I didn't open it once. Didn't give us the lecture slides until right before the final. You don't really know what to expect with assign.

I did not like his teaching style. Tries to teach too much in a short time. No feedback on the papers. He gets irritated easily. It feels like he comes to teach because he needs the money, not because he really wants too.

John's an awesome instructor and injects some punishingly funny humour into his lectures that morons and air headed university girls cant quite grasp. *Very* funny prof with a ton of life experience outside the academy. Easily one of the better profs I've ever had at SFU. If you can't connect with what John's teaching, *you're* the problem.
